Cuisine - Hotelenzian EN DE Hotel Enzian The Enzian History & hosts 5 reasons for vacation Live Image & Weather Digital Guest Directory Hygiene measures Enzian News Rooms & Offers Room Overview Package Overview Included services Worth knowing Cuisine Active & Relaxed Activities Winter Summer Activities Overview Service Contact & Location Voucher Newsletter Taxi Zürs Visit us! +43 5583 22420 office@hotelenzian.com EN DE +43 5583 22420 office@hotelenzian.com Voucher Inquiry Book now Call Book a room Inquire now Gift a Voucher Visit us! Zürs 84 | A-6763 Zürs am Arlberg Culinary pleasure Dining experience for all senses Restaurant & hotel for connoisseurs Our kitchen team will spoil you with traditional Austrian specialities as well as international delicacies with products mainly from the region. Our dedicated service team is happy to recommend enjoyable wine experiences in or from the well-stocked Austrian wine cellar “Zur Reblaus”. Restaurant Enzian Stube & sun terrace Culinary delights on the hillside for a lunch stop or for fine enjoyment in the evening – it is a good place to sit in the original “Zirbenstube”. The cozy atmosphere invites you to linger. Experience culinary delights made from regional, international and seasonal products . Or would you prefer a delicious fondue? Our sun terrace – the hotspot in Zürs am Arlberg with a fantastic view of the ski and mountain world Visit us in WINTER Opening hours Lunch 11.30 am to 01.45 pm For a well-deserved lunch break from the lunch menu. Lunch menu Afternoon snack 01.45 pm to 05.00 pm For a well-deserved stop in the afternoon from the snack menu. Dinner 06.00 pm to 08.30 pm To enjoy in good company from the evening menu. Dinner menu Make your table reservation: email: office@hotelenzian.com phone: +43 5583 22420 Sun terrace Visit us in SUMMER Opening hours Lunch 12.00 am to 02.00 pm For a well-deserved lunch break from the lunch menu. Lunch menu summer 2025 Afternoon snack 02.00 pm to 06.00 pm For a well-deserved stop in the afternoon from the snack menu. Snacks summer 2025 Dinner 06.00 pm to 08.00 pm To enjoy in good company from the evening menu. Dinner summer 2025 For dinner make your table reservation: email: office@hotelenzian.com phone: +43 5583 22420 hotel bar Place for get-togethers Our hotel bar with its stylish ambience is the ideal meeting point for interesting encounters, social gatherings, a cozy chat with friends or simply for a pleasant end to a wonderful day on holiday. And staying there becomes a special moment . How about an afternoon tea ? Enjoy your tea or coffee break with your holiday reading in an elegant atmosphere . Start with a delicious aperiti f to get you in the mood for the 5-course evening meal as part of the Enzian half-board or before your dinner in our Enzian Stube. Have an enjoyable cocktail mixed for you, choose from the finest spirits or enjoy fine wines from our wine cellar . Our bar team is also available for alcohol-free enjoyment . Is your four-legged friend accompanying you on your holiday? Your dog is allowed and welcome at the hotel bar. included services Enzian half-board in our hotel restaurant Sumptuous buffet-style breakfast with assorted teas and juices from the bar Daily afternoon snack between 4:00 pm and 5:00 pm (in winter) 5- course degustation dinner with choice of menu (in winter) Various themed buffet evenings (in winter) 3- course dinner menu (in summer) Kid´s menu Sundays: Gala-Gourmet-Dinner with a glass of sparkling wine (in winter) refreshing welcome drink (in summer) Intolerances Please let us know of any food intolerances and allergies before your arrival. We try to respond to all wishes and special requirements as far as possible. Zur Reblaus Selected wines from our wine cellar In our wine cellar “Zur Reblaus” you can expect an exquisite selection of wine specialities and tastings full of passion for the fine wines with our hosts Richard and Denny. Embark on a taste journey through the most beautiful and best wine regions , especially in Austria. Our experienced service staff will be happy to advise you and help you choose the right wine for your meal.

Enzian | Home Systems Group Home Who Are We? What is Enzian? Why Enzian? Updates Tech Nuggets Projects Publications Documentation FAQ Subscribe to the mailing list for updates. Enzian is a research computer built by the Systems Group at ETH Zurich. As a research computer, Enzian is designed for computer systems
software research and deliberately over-engineered. Enzian
has a big server-class CPU closely coupled to a large FPGA, with
ample main memory and network bandwidth on both sides. If you want to cite Enzian in your work, use the citation for our ASPLOS 2022 paper .
You can find the bibtex citation on our FAQ page . Several institutions are already using Enzian. If you think your work could benefit
from Enzian contact us at enzian-contact@lists.inf.ethz.ch . October 24, 2022 Enzian at the seL4 Summit 2022 The seL4 Summit took place
earlier this month in Munich, and the Enzian team was represented by Daniel
Schwyn , giving a talk about Trustworthy
BMCs ( recording available
here ). October 13, 2022 RISC-V on Enzian Thanks to the hard work of a bachelor’s student, Diego de los Santos, we
have brought up the Rocket RISC-V core on the Enzian’s
FPGA. We are able to load an image from the CPU side, across ECI, directly into the FPGA’s DRAM.
We can then boot into Linux on the RISC-V core. While clock speed is obviously limited in the FPGA implementation 
(currently 100MHz) this is still many orders of magnitude faster than RTL simulation. This allows us to run
more realistic, larger memory benchmarks on RISC-V. We can then examine power and performance implications of various microarchitectural changes. September 26, 2022 Identifying an Enzian over USB As we explained in our post about the Enzian rear panel there are two client USB ports on Enzian:
one for the JTAG scain chain and one for the system UARTs.
The JTAG chip on the Enzian main board has a pre-configured JTAG cable ID that is unique.
The serial-to-USB converter by default does not have a unique ID though.
If you just plug one Enzian into your machine that does not matter, however we have 9 of these machines all plugged into our gateway server. We built Enzian to have a platform for our research into
operating systems, databases, hardware acceleration, machine
learning, networking, and high-performance computing, and because
there was nothing comparable out there that we could get hold of
otherwise. Now that it works, we’d like to make Enzian systems available
to the rest of the research community.  If you want to work with
Enzian, or if you might be able to help us make it more widely
available, please contact us! © 2024 ETH Zurich

Food - Enzian Theater Menu Film + / Films & Events + / Calendar + / Special Programs + / Festivals + / Food + / Friends + / Membership + / Donate + / Sponsor + / Volunteer + / Theater Rental + / Enzian Shop + / Call or visit the box office with any questions 1300 SOUTH ORLANDO MAITLAND, FL 32751 (407) 629-0054 | Search for: Search for: EDEN BAR HOURS Monday & Tuesday: 4 – 11PM; Closed for Lunch Wednesday & Thursday: 11AM –11PM Friday & Saturday: 11AM – 1AM Sunday: 11AM – 11PM KITCHEN HOURS POSTED BELOW Enjoy lunch or dinner at Eden Bar, Central Florida’s best alfresco dining destination. With daily food and drink specials, lunch offerings, and a late night menu, Central Florida’s most unique outdoor restaurant and bar doesn’t even need the movie to go with it. Although Eden Bar is outdoors, we are a non-smoking establishment, and appreciate your help in keeping it a safe and healthy environment for everyone. Please note: 18% gratuity will be added to any unsigned checks at Enzian and Eden Bar. Looking to host an event at Eden Bar? Contact shuskins@enzian.org for more information! Eden Bar hours are subject to extreme weather conditions. To confirm its hours of operations during these circumstances please call 407-629-1088 ext. 230. We produce much of our food in-house, with an unwavering commitment to quality ingredients, and choosing to work with independent businesses, farmers, brewers, and artisans, locally whenever possible. Press - Enzian Theater Menu Film + / Films & Events + / Calendar + / Special Programs + / Festivals + / Food + / Friends + / Membership + / Donate + / Sponsor + / Volunteer + / Theater Rental + / Enzian Shop + / Call or visit the box office with any questions 1300 SOUTH ORLANDO MAITLAND, FL 32751 (407) 629-0054 | Search for: Search for: Press Room The Public Relations Department of Enzian is dedicated to supplying members of the press and media with resources about Enzian and Eden Bar. Press releases are distributed via e-mail as well as available to download below. Click here to send a request to be added to the media database that receives email press release updates. High-resolution press images are available for download here or by special request from the Public Relations Department on an individual basis. Members of the press and media are encouraged to contact the Public Relations Department if they need any additional information or have questions regarding Enzian, its films, festivals, or special events. Enzian Press Contact Paige Babbage | pbabbage@enzian.org Recent Press Releases Enzian Presents New Monthly Midnight Series: Freaky Fridays – December 2021 Enzian Presents 12 Days of Christmas – November 2021 Enzian Presents the 29th Annual Brouhaha Film & Video Showcase – November 2021 Enzian Presents the 23rd Annual Central Florida Jewish Film Festival – October 2021 Enzian and the Asian Cultural Association Present the 27th Annual South Asian Film Festival – September 2021 Enzian Presents “13 Films and Cocktails of Halloween” Throughout October – August 2021 Enzian Announces Four “Meet the Filmmaker” Events – August 2021 Enzian Partners with Opera Orlando and Orlando Ballet for Annual Summer Opera & Ballet Series – June 2021 Enzian to Host “Reel Representation: Diversity in Film” Showcase – May 2021 New HVAC Installed for Safer Indoor Screenings – February 2021 Enzian and the Asian Cultural Association Present the 26th Annual South Asian Film Festival – September 2020 Enzian Presents “13+ Films and Cocktails of Halloween” Throughout October – September 2020 Enzian Presents New Season of National Theatre Live Productions – August 2020 Enzian Theater Announces Stanley Kubrick Week – July 2020 Enzian Theater Announces Spike Lee Week and The Rental – July 2020 Enzian Theater Announces Focus Features Favorites Week and The Truth – July 2020 Enzian Theater Announces The Empire Strikes Back and Horror Film Relic – July 2020 Enzian Announces Christopher Nolan Week and John Lewis Documentary – June 2020 Enzian Theater Announces Universal Classic Monsters Week and Ella Fitzgerald Documentary – June 2020 Enzian Theater Announces John Hughes Week and Award-Winning Drama Babyteeth – June 2020 Enzian Reopens with Alfred Hitchcock Week, The Trip to Greece, A Free Screening of I Am Not Your Negro, and more! These activities include, but are not limited to, hiring and firing of staff, selection of volunteers and vendors, and provision of services. We are committed to providing an inclusive and welcoming environment for all staff, patrons, volunteers, and vendors. Matthew Curtis : Programming Director Peter DiPietro Technical Director Where Are You From or Where Did you Grow Up? Philadelphia suburbs, PA Favorite Movie(s) or Movie Genre: I love the Step Up movies What Movie Could you Watch over and over?: Sixteen Candles Favorite Enzian Series: Cult Classics Favorite Type of Music or Musician (s) : Pop Favorite TV Show (s) : Last Week Tonight with John Oliver Best Concert You’ve Ever Been to: Lollapalooza 1992 and Prince 2003 Favorite Place You’ve Ever Traveled to: Cruise to Bermuda Where Would You Like to Travel to?: Europe and South America My Guilty Pleasure Is… Ke$ha (I know, but I prefer the dollar sign era) Have Any Pets?: Just Beowulf, the Enzian resident cat Are You More of a Cat or Dog Person?: Cat person What are Some of Your Hobbies ? : Crossword puzzles and the Wordle, pinball, bicycling What’s Your Favorite Part About Working at Enzian? Just being a part of such an iconic Orlando institution Rachel Harley Events Coordinator Where Are You From or Where Did you Grow Up? Apopka, Florida Favorite Movie(s) or Movie Genre: The Third Man, First Reformed, and Tombstone What Movie Could you Watch over and over? Moonstruck. The chemistry between Nicholas Cage and Cher is crazy! Favorite Drink to Sip On at Eden Bar: Any fun mocktails the bartenders can create for me Favorite Enzian/Eden Bar Food: Crispy Brussel Sprouts Favorite Place You’ve Ever Traveled to: Vancouver, BC. If You Could Have Dinner with Anyone (Dead or Alive), Who Would it be and Why?: Orson Welles. I find his absurd self aggrandizing to be charming. My Guilty Pleasure Is…: The county fair! The thrill of my fragile mortality makes the whole experience that much better. Have Any Pets?: My boy, Alfred, a Black Mouth Cur Are You More of a Cat or Dog Person?: Dog, definitely. What are Some of Your Hobbies?: I have a film/supper club that I host once a month. I also enjoy travelling around Florida, and some surrounding states, to hike through the parks with Alfred. Tim Anderson Programming Coordinator Favorite Quote or Personal Motto:  “I will not make any more boring art” – John Baldessari My favorite movie is Casablanca. but I love Silent, Foreign, Horror, and Experimental Films If a movie title could describe my life, it would be: “Women on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown” (take that however you want) If I could have dinner with anyone, it would be Andy Warhol – he’s the person most singularly responsible for my career trajectory My Guilty Pleasure is coming-of-age movies (Now and Then, Can’t Hardly Wait, Fast Times at Ridgemont High, Empire Records) Pets: I have 4 cats, two of which might secretly hate me. Other Fun Fact(s): I was a regular “featured extra” on the New Mickey Mouse Club and hit Britney Spears in the head (accidentally) during a scene where I had to drag her out of a restaurant. Jo Gilley (They/Them) Box Manager & Development Coordinator Where Are You From or Where Did you Grow Up? California Favorite Movie(s) or Movie Genre: Millennium Mambo What Movie Could you Watch over and over?: The Last Holiday Favorite Drink to Sip On at Eden Bar: Ginger ale Favorite Place You’ve Ever Traveled to: Joshua Tree, California If You Could Have Dinner with Anyone (Dead or Alive), Who Would it be and Why?: Francis Bacon, He’s my favorite artist and to be able to pick his brain a bit would be so dreamy. Top 3 Things on Your Bucket List: I’d like to travel to Norway, work in film restoration, and drink enough coffee to become a walking vibrational frequency Have Any Pets?: Two cats Are You More of a FAQ - Enzian Theater Menu Film + / Films & Events + / Calendar + / Special Programs + / Festivals + / Food + / Friends + / Membership + / Donate + / Sponsor + / Volunteer + / Theater Rental + / Enzian Shop + / Call or visit the box office with any questions 1300 SOUTH ORLANDO MAITLAND, FL 32751 (407) 629-0054 | Search for: Search for: Because we are unlike anywhere else, we do things a little differently. We want your visit to go smoothly whether it’s your first or 100th time at Enzian. HOW DO I FIND OUT WHAT’S PLAYING OR COMING SOON? We offer daily programming with additional special programming throughout the month. Please check our Films page or call the Movie Info Line at (407) 629-0054 for the most accurate and up-to-date information about showtimes and tickets. Please note that all “coming soon” dates are subject to change. I WANT TO COME SEE A FILM AT ENZIAN. WHAT DO I DO? Once you have chosen the show you wish to see, you will need to purchase tickets online or in person at the Box Office. Opening weekends, Cult Classics and other special programming tend to sell out quickly and buying tickets in advance is strongly encouraged. Tickets may also be purchased the day of the show, but availability cannot be guaranteed. When a screening reaches capacity, you may place your name on a wait list . DO I NEED A RESERVATION? Table reservations are available to members of the Enzian Film Society at the Contributor level and above. Anyone can see a film at Enzian, and anyone can become a member. For Regular level and non-members, seating is on a first-come basis. We recommend that all guests arrive 45 minutes before the start of the show to get in line for tickets and seating. For opening weekends, Cult Classics, and special events, you may want to arrive earlier. Theater doors open for seating approximately 30 minutes before the show. WHEN IS THE BOX OFFICE OPEN? The Box Office hours are Monday – Thursday from 3:00 PM – 9:30 PM, and Friday – Sunday from Noon – 9:30 PM. HOW MUCH ARE TICKETS? Tickets start at $12.50 General Admission $11 Students, Seniors (62+) & Military (ID required) $11 Matinee (before 4PM) $10.00 Members of Enzian Film Society For discounts, click here to learn more about becoming a member of the Enzian Film Society. WHAT HAPPENS IF I PURCHASE MY TICKETS ONLINE? You will be placed on our door list for the show. There is no need to stop by the Box Office. Simply line up for seating (if you choose) and give your first and last name to the house manager taking tickets as you enter the theater. WHAT IS ENZIAN’S WAIT LIST POLICY? For sold out screenings, Enzian often offers a standby option. Due to the unique layout of our theater, being “sold out” of general admission tickets does not necessarily mean there won’t be seats available during the performance. If possible, we will try to accommodate additional seating through our standby process. How standby works: Visit the Enzian Box Office one hour before showtime to receive a numbered standby card At showtime, line up at the Box Office in order of numbered cards Staff will count available seats and try to seat as many standby card holders as we can Standby seating is not guaranteed and is always at staff discretion. Standby may not be available for every show. For any questions about ticket quantity, availability, and seating options please contact the Enzian Box Office . To avoid missing a busy show, we always recommend that you purchase your tickets in advance or become a Contributor Member of the Enzian Film Society , which enables you to make table reservations to guarantee a place for your party. DO YOU SERVE FOOD AND DRINKS? HOW DOES THAT WORK? Yes! We offer food at our outdoor pavilion, Eden Bar as well as inside the theater. You do not have to see a film to attend and dine in our outside area. Eden Bar offers a full dining menu and full bar. Our theater is arranged like a dining room in front of the screen. We have four tiers of tables for two or four, single seats, and couches. Once you are seated, a server will come to your table and take your order. A full dining menu is available, as well as a beer and wine list. Liquor drinks are not available for order inside the theater. Food times may take longer than a normal dining experience as we serve up to 230 guests menu items prepared fresh and carefully. Thank you in advance for your patience. Dining is optional and the dress is casual. HOW DO I GET MY COMPANY’S SLIDE ON THE SCREEN BEFORE EACH SHOW? Your business, restaurant, or travel destination can reach attractive, upscale new customers using one of today’s most effective advertising media while supporting Central Florida’s premier art house cinema café, Enzian. Click here for more information on slide advertising, contact development@enzian.org or call 407-629-1088 ext. 303. WHERE CAN I FIND INFORMATION ABOUT CLOSED CAPTIONING? Please check the film you’re interested in seeing on our website. The film page will specify if closed captioning is available for that film. Upon arriving to the theater, you will be given printed materials that explain how to use the closed captioning glasses. Our staff and managers are knowledgeable on the closed captioning system and can assist with any specific questions you may have. City Hall - Enzian Theater Menu Film + / Films & Events + / Calendar + / Special Programs + / Festivals + / Food + / Friends + / Membership + / Donate + / Sponsor + / Volunteer + / Theater Rental + / Enzian Shop + / Call or visit the box office with any questions 1300 SOUTH ORLANDO MAITLAND, FL 32751 (407) 629-0054 | Search for: Search for: City Hall - Enzian Theater Enzian Theater City Hall Click Showtimes to Purchase Tickets Enzian On Demand City Hall Stream new release City Hall and support Enzian! Here’s how this works: For $12, the service provider will grant you access to the film, which is viewable on any internet-connected device including laptops, tablets, and smartphones. If you have the appropriate technology (Chromecast, Amazon Firestick, AirPlay, Apple TV, Smart TV, etc), you may be able to stream this to your television at home from your computer or phone. If you have any questions or concerns regarding your order, you can visit the Help Page or contact the streaming platform here . For every purchase of City Hall from Friday, November 13th, through Thursday, November 26th, nearly 50% goes directly back to Enzian in an effort to support us. We appreciate your support! Click Here to Stream City Hall » Certified Fresh with 100% on Rotten Tomatoes! City government touches almost every aspect of our lives. Most of us are unaware of or take for granted these necessary services such as police, fire, sanitation, veterans affairs, elder support, parks, licensing of various professional activities, recordkeeping of birth, marriage and death as well as hundreds of other activities that support Boston residents and visitors. CITY HALL, by Frederick Wiseman, shows the efforts by Boston city government to provide these services. The film also illustrates the variety of ways the city administration enters into civil discourse with the citizens of Boston. Mayor Martin J. Walsh and his administration are presented addressing a number of their policy priorities which include racial justice, affordable housing, climate action, and homelessness. CITY HALL shows a city government successfully offering a wide variety of services to a diverse population. USA, 2020, 275 minutes, Not Rated, Directed by Frederick Wiseman Upcoming Programming Popcorn Flicks in the Park Encanto Special Program CatVideoFest 2025 Saturday Matinee Classics/Enzian Film Club Ran (4k Restoration) Music Mondays Ron Delsener Presents Enzian Theater is proudly powered by WordPress TICKETS START AT Regular $12.50 Student/Senior/Military (with ID) $11.00 Matinees $11.00 Film Society Members $10.00 CONTACT 1300 South Orlando Avenue Maitland, FL 32751 Info Line: (407) 629-0054 Theater Offices: (407) 629-1088 About | COVID-19 Safety | FAQ | Mission + Leadership | Theater Rental | Volunteer | Press | Jobs | Privacy | Contact | Home Calendar Donate Food

MEETINGS & EVENTS – Enzian Inn – Leavenworth Link to Facebook Link to Instagram PHONE: 509.548.5269 GALLERY ACCOMMODATIONS AMENITIES DINING MEETINGS & EVENTS STEINBOCK RESORTS BOOK NOW Menu Menu MEETINGS & EVENTS Allow our hospitality and events team to create an event tailored to your individual needs. With meeting space ranging from 350sf – 1,100sf and on-site catering provided by our chefs, we are able to accommodate a wide range of requests and would love to assist you in hosting your next board meeting, church retreat, strategy session or boutique conference. 509-548-5269 | INFO@ENZIANINN.COM CONFERENCES, MEETINGS, & EVENTS Meeting and Banquet Rooms Five unique meeting and event rooms with over 8300 sf of event space. Catered events are served amidst stunning views in our Fourth Floor Solarium Banquet Room. All meeting rooms have complimentary wifi and flat screen projection with HDMI or VGA connectivity. Our largest meeting room has three screen projection. Perfect for speakers and presenters. Audio /projection packages include lectern, wired or wireless mics, including lapel mics.  Our staff is here to provide what you need to present your event. Located just a stroll across the street from Village restaurants, shops, and activities it is easy to connect in Leavenworth. Our friendly, knowledgeable staff is always willing to help your guests discover local venues, activities, and sights. The Enzian is well known for it’s guest amenities—our daily breakfast buffet with omelet bar, morning alphorn serenade, the 18 hole Enzian Falls Putting Course, indoor and outdoor pool and hot tub, racquetball/basketball court, fitness room, wifi in all lodging rooms, always easy/free parking and no hidden charges.  Your guests deserve the best  all the time, every time. GENERAL CONFERENCES & RETREATS The Enzian Inn has an outstanding reputation for providing Conferences and Retreats with warm hospitality and personalized service. Our experiences sales,  hospitality and catering team are ready to facilitate every aspect of your event for 12-180 attendees. Five unique meeting and event rooms Over 8300 sf of event space with Solarium Banquet Room for catered meals or hospitality gatherings. All meeting rooms have complimentary wifi and flat screen projection with HDMI or VGA connectivity. Our largest meeting room has three screen projection. Audio /projection packages include lectern, wired or wireless mics, including  lapel mics.  Polycom service available.  Conference Aids are always complimentary when requested. SMALL GROUP MEETING PACKAGES These inclusive packages make it easy to plan for groups under 30 attendees, and manage costs effectively and affordably. Perfect for Board Retreats and Small Meetings. Per night charges enable you to plan your perfect fit – an overnight or extended stay meeting. Inclusive rate includes Continuous Coffee Service, Break Service, In Room Meeting Lunch, Meeting Room, A/V and Conference Aids. MINISTRY RETREATS & GATHERINGS The Enzian Inn has created a venue packet specific to churches and the needs of ministry. Information is presented in a manner that makes it easy for all departments, ministry leaders, administrators, and the church family. Small churches can expand their walls and scope of ministry here. Large churches can create the smaller arena so necessary for connectivity. We welcome you. We welcome your call to share more about how the Enzian Inn can partner with your church. SOCIAL GROUPS & GATHERINGS It is an honor to work in the hospitality industry and a great joy to be part of bringing people together, to reconnect and to build new and ongoing memories. If you are a professional, class, military, or family reunion, we are pleased to help you bring your family and friends to Leavenworth’s Enzian Inn. With 33 single queen rooms and 55 double queen rooms, plus deluxe and suite offerings, we can provide well for families and reunion groups of all sizes. Our fourth floor solarium dining room, makes our complimentary breakfast an event and a good time to share and catch up with the people dear to our hearts. Please talk with the sales office about gathering rooms or reserving banquet space for a catered meal, or with help in finding local venues that your group will enjoy for off site options. CATERING GUIDELINES & SAMPLE MENU Our menus offer a variety of selections and services to provide onsite catering for your event. Our beautiful Continental Room can host banquets, buffet style or served meals and receptions with an array of hors d’ oeuvres. We can also provide services delivered to conference rooms such as small meeting lunches. Try one of our fun themed break services or order ala carte. Our Director of Catered Events is available to assist in making selections that are customized to fit your schedule and event. We look forward to serving you at your next conference. Groups over 120 will have a specialized banquet menu created to fit the vision of a large event. Similar menu options will be offered for all events. Click here to download Venue & General Information Packet. Evening for Two – $40 2 Regular Film Admission & $15 to spend on food & drink at Enzian or Eden Bar A Gift of Film – $12.50 1 Regular Film Admission Enzian Sticker Pack –  $10 Purchase a 4-Pack of stickers to represent your favorite local art house theater on water bottles, laptop cases, your phone… wherever you want! Sticker packs purchased online are mailed out within two days to the address specified while checking out. They make a great add-on to any gift! E-Bucks (any increment of $5) E-bucks can be spent on anything at Enzian or Eden Bar, like Food, Drinks, or Tickets to movies & events! Gift of Membership Starting at $60. When purchasing online, you will need to provide an address for a physical certificate to be shipped to, and your order cannot also contain tickets to an event. You may provide a special message for the recipient in the “comments/special instructions” section, which we will include on a card in the envelope. Gift certificates are put in the mail within two days and must be redeemed in person. If you have any questions, please contact us at boxoffice@enzian.org or 407-629-1088 ext 0230. Who We Are | Eden Project Skip to content Main Menu Resources (Re)Story (Re)Form JH Retreats EL Cohorts Give Who We Are We’re glad you’re here! Let us intro­duce you to the people behind The Eden Project. The Eden Team is made up of men and women with a passion for people to experience and learn to live at home in the love of God. The Team represents a diverse background with decades of leadership and pastoral experience, supported by a deeply invested and engaged board of directors. The Eden Team Nathan Wagnon Co-Founder & CEO Chuck Gschwend Co-Founder & Director of Eden Lead Duke Revard Co-Founder & Eden Lead Marketplace Dustin Flueckiger Director of Development Melissa Miller Women’s Director Eric Field​ Marketing Coordinator Lindy Gschwend Eden Lead Assistant The Eden Project Board Nathan Wagnon Co-Founder & CEO, The Eden Project Brett Bruster Lay Leader, Watermark Church Gordon Ip President, Genesis Real Estate Group Eddy Badrina CEO, Eden Green Technology Pat Dunne JPMChase & BOK Financial (Retired) The Eden Project team believes there are no experts in the company of Jesus . . . we are all learners. We are committed to helping people experience and live at home in the love of God. If you’d like to contact any of our team members please email info@edenteam.org . Eden Newsletter Sign up to receive weekly emails that include teaching, personal stories, and ways to connect with the Eden Project. All subscribers also receive a free copy of our Triad Guide & How to Pray the Psalms Guide ! We also use third-party cookies that help us analyze and understand how you use this website. These cookies will be stored in your browser only with your consent. Non-necessary Non-necessary Any cookies that may not be particularly necessary for the website to function and is used specifically to collect user personal data via analytics, ads, other embedded contents are termed as non-necessary cookies.
